bug.author: lcerman
bug.summary: number_input for floats switches to int after the value in the widget is changed.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
After the value is changed in the number_input widget (either by the buttons or by editing the text field), its starts returning int types instead of float. Appears in both Firefox and Chrome. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create:
import streamlit as st
v = st.number_input('Test', value=1.) st.write(v, type(v))
Run the streamlit. Navigate to the streamlit page in browser and change the value in the widget.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Output has float type. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Output changes to int type (and is rounded, of course) after value modification. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no (number_input was not in the prev version...) <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.49.0 Python version: 3.6.8 python -m venv venv OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 inside WSL under Windows 10 Browser version: Firefox 70.0.1 (64-bit), Chrome 78.0.3904.70 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)
